wikipedia_page.main: John Bartholomew Sr. (26 April 1805 – 8 April 1861) was a Scottish cartographer and engraver.

response: Around 1826 John Bartholomew Sr. opened a firm dedicated to the production of maps called 'John Bartholomew and Sons'. In 1888, John George Bartholomew, having taken over the company and hoping to create 'a site for the promotion of national geographic knowledge', renamed the publishers to the 'Edinburgh Geographical Institute'.
